intro: Toxophoenix, commonly known as the African silverleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or yellow when ripe. Toxophoenix species are often used in ornamental horticulture due to their attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil conditions. They are also valued for their ability to thrive in arid environments.
